text: The Justice Select Committee is a committee made up of a small number of members of the British House of Commons. The committee looks at the policy, management and spending of the Ministry of Justice. It also looks at the work of the Law Officers of the Crown, the Serious Fraud Office, and the Crown Prosecution Service. It gives reports with opinions and advice. The committee also reviews draft Sentencing Guidelines issued by the Sentencing Guidelines Council. ==References== Category:Parliamentary select committees of the United Kingdom Category:House of Commons of the United Kingdom Category:Law enforcement in the United Kingdom
title: Justice Select Committee
